content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col) 
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s|-]" => "_")
end
```

This function works as follows:
1. `lowercase(col)` turns all the characters in `col` to lowercase, so "My Column" becomes "my column". 
2. `strip(col)` removes any leading or trailing whitespaces from `col`, so " my column " becomes "my column ". 
3. `replace(..., r"[\s|-]" => "_")` replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores in the cleaned column name, resulting in "my_column".
